item.title: Ultimate Fallout 76 Daily Challenges Location Guide ‚Äì Find Creatures and Items For Tasks
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fallout-76-daily-challenges-location-guides/

In Fallout 76, one of the peskiest things you‚Äôll need to do is complete daily and weekly challenges. They might be to kill three Snallygasters or drink five Nuka Cola Cranberry beverages. It might be as trivial as picking up a handful of scrap items or something as challenging as laying waste to a horde of Deathclaws.

In this ultimate guide to Fallout 76 challenge locations, I‚Äôll help you find everything you need to complete these challenges. As the challenges expand over time, so too will this guide, so be sure to bookmark it to keep coming back for more.

In no particular order, let‚Äôs start cracking through where to find these deliverables for Fallout 76 daily challenges.

Table of contents

  • Where to Find Snallygasters in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find Gulpers in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find Teapots in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find Mirelurk Eggs in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find Rabbits in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find a Bobblehead in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find Magazines in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find Wood in Fallout 76
  • Where to Find Soap in Fallout 76

Where to Find Snallygasters in Fallout 76

If you‚Äôre tasked with killing Snallygasters in Fallout 76 for a daily challenge, you‚Äôll want to head to the nastier areas of the map, typically where you‚Äôll find swamps, toxic pools, and other environmental hazards.

The best place to find a Snallygaster in Fallout 76 (or three) is the Flooded Trainyard.

If you head to the Flooded Trainyard in Fallout 76, you‚Äôll be greeted by as many as half a dozen Snallygasters, ripe for the taking.

But where is the Flooded Trainyard?

Well, you‚Äôll need to head out to the Cranberry Bog to find it:

The next best Snallygaster location in Fallout 76 is near Hemlock Holes in the Toxic Valley at the top of the map. If you head south from Hemlock Holes, you‚Äôll find Snallygasters and even a Grafton Monster.

Hemlock Holes can be found here:

Where to Find Gulpers in Fallout 76

It can be quite tough to track down a decent Gulper location in Fallout 76, but it‚Äôs not impossible. If you want to find Gulpers for a Fallout 76 daily challenge, you‚Äôll need to head into The Mire and track through the dark and dingy forest.

The best place to find Gulpers in Fallout 76 is at the Gulper Lagoon ‚Äì the clue is in the name, you see.

Here‚Äôs the top spot for Gulpers for daily challenges:

Alternatively, you could wait around for Moonshine Jamboree to pop. That event is positively bursting with Gulpers, so you‚Äôll complete this daily challenge to kill Gulpers in no time at all.

Where to Find Teapots in Fallout 76

It might seem bizarre, but Fallout 76‚Äôs daily challenge structure can include a request to find teapots for no reason whatsoever. It‚Äôs one of the trickier daily challenges as it requires you to find something small in a very large map, and ground loot can often seem randomised.

Fear not ‚Äì it‚Äôs not all that difficult to find a teapot in Fallout 76, and if you need multiple, you can try server hopping to see if more teapots pop up.

To secure the best teapot locations in Fallout 76, you‚Äôll want to check out the Palace of the Winding Path. At this location, you‚Äôll find more than a dozen teapots scattered around.

This is where you‚Äôll find teapots in Fallout 76 with ease:

If you can‚Äôt find teapots at the Palace of the Winding Path, you can try elsewhere. The next best location for teapots in Fallout 76 is Helvetia, the small town near Vault 76. Here, you‚Äôll find half a dozen (or more) teapots lurking around:

Where to Find Mirelurk Eggs in Fallout 76

Forget the Mirelurks themselves, some Fallout 76 daily challenges want you to find Mirelurk Eggs. As you can imagine, you‚Äôll almost always find the two together, so it could be a case of killing two birds with one stone.

It‚Äôs easy to find the best Fallout 76 Mirelurk Egg locations, though.

If you head to Quarry X3 in the Cranberry Bog, you‚Äôll find dozens of Mirelurk Eggs. Be warned, though ‚Äì you‚Äôll have to tussle with Mirelurks and even a Mirelurk Queen if you‚Äôre unlucky:

The next best location for Mirelurk Eggs in Fallout 76 is around the Ohio River Adventures site. If you explore the riverbanks around this location, you‚Äôll find Mirelurk Eggs everywhere:

Where to Find Rabbits in Fallout 76

It‚Äôs tough to find Rabbits in Fallout 76 because they‚Äôre so small and they blend in well with the environment, but with a keen eye (and perhaps VATS), you‚Äôll be able to find a few for your daily challenges.

The best location for Rabbits in Fallout 76 is near the Whitespring Bunker. Here, you‚Äôll need to explore the area, but you should manage to find Rabbits easily and tick off some Fallout 76 daily challenges:

If you can‚Äôt find any Rabbits near the Whitespring Bunker, you can try checking the Twin Lakes location in the Savage Divide. This is the next best location for Rabbits in Fallout 76:

Where to Find a Bobblehead in Fallout 76

Every Fallout fan knows about the Vault-Tec Bobbleheads. They‚Äôre everywhere throughout the series, and they come with some seriously helpful character upgrades.

In Fallout 76, Bobbleheads tend to spawn in static locations, which means they‚Äôll always be there whenever you jump onto a new server ‚Äì unless someone has grabbed one first.

Here are some of the best Bobblehead locations in Fallout 76:

On top of the mansion at Clancy Manor:

In Camden Park, near the Minor Miner Zone Sign or on top of the Widowmaker rollercoaster:

In Morgantown Airport, sitting in a quarantine tent and in the laboratory hanger near the airstrip

There are hundreds of Bobblehead locations in Fallout 76, but these are some of the most reliable. Let me know in the comments where you go to find Bobbleheads in Fallout 76.

Where to Find Magazines in Fallout 76

Like Bobbleheads, Magazine locations in Fallout 76 are static, and you‚Äôll find consistent spawns everywhere. Unfortunately, Fallout 76 Magazines are also in high demand all the time, so you‚Äôll need to have luck on your side or have access to a private server to find one.

There are some top Magazine locations in Fallout 76 that you can try checking before you‚Äôve even walked too far from Vault 76, which is nice.

Check the south cabin and the treehouse in the Alpine River Cabins:

Check the main reception counter, the kitchens, and the bunk beds in Bolton Greens:

Check the airplane seats, the kitchen platform, and the cockpit of the plane at Horizon‚Äôs Rest:

All of these locations yield multiple Magazines in Fallout 76, so you should be able to find at least one or two to resolve these daily challenges.

Where to Find Wood in Fallout 76

It‚Äôs a relatively mundane thing to track down, but many daily challenges in Fallout 76 revolve around finding building materials. In this challenge, you‚Äôll be tasked with finding Wood locations in Fallout 76. It might seem easy, but it‚Äôs not ‚Äì you can‚Äôt just go cutting down trees, after all.

The best location to find Wood in Fallout 76 is at the Sylvie & Sons Logging Camp. This location can be found in the Savage Divide close to the Sons of Dane Compound, and it‚Äôs bursting with Wood for daily challenges in Fallout 76:

Where to Find Soap in Fallout 76

Finding Soap in Fallout 76 is important, as keeping clean in the harsh, post-apocalyptic wasteland is something all explorers should be doing. Perhaps not, but that doesn‚Äôt stop the Fallout 76 daily challenges circuit from tasking you with finding stacks of Soap in the game.

It‚Äôs a little tougher to find Soap as it‚Äôs not guaranteed to spawn in many places. However, I‚Äôve tracked down the best locations for Soap in Fallout 76, so you don‚Äôt have to.

The easiest location for Soap in Fallout 76 is at the Whitespring Resort. Here, you can access the Whitespring Mall, and from there, you‚Äôll track down the Whitespring Spa. In the Spa, you‚Äôll find up to seven Soap at one time:

If you can‚Äôt find any at the Whitespring Resort, you can find Soap in Fallout 76 by heading to Darling Sister‚Äôs Lab ‚Äì just don‚Äôt ask me what they were doing with this much soap:

Here, you‚Äôll find seven Soap just sitting in a wheelbarrow.

item.title: Call of Duty Montage Lets Slip That Two Fan-Favourite Rifles Could Be Coming Back
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/warzone-return-amax-kilo-trailer/

Recently, Activision took to social media to promote International Women‚Äôs Day with a Call of Duty trailer focused on female characters. The punchy montage showcased some of the most popular female streamers and in-game operators, but it also let slip a few key details about the future of Call of Duty.

In a couple of sequences in the montage, we see current operators running around with AMAX and Kilo assault rifles. These instantly recognisable weapons were firm favourites when Verdansk was rolling around in Warzone between 2020 and 2021, and it looks like they‚Äôre coming back.

Hit the Nostalgia

It was mentioned recently that if Verdansk‚Äôs return to Warzone is a flop, Warzone itself could be on the rocks and scheduled for closure. At the very least, Activision will scale back resources and prepare to keep Warzone afloat with a skeleton crew, as the downfall of the battle royale has been unravelling over the last couple of years.

When season three arrives in Call of Duty next month, following a sizeable delay, it should bring with it the original Verdansk map from 2020. That‚Äôs not all, though ‚Äì according to the recent Call of Duty montage released by Activision, we‚Äôre also set to get some OG weapons back, too.

I‚Äôm holding out hope that the Grau makes a return, but I‚Äôll settle for the AMAX and Kilo. There are so many ‚Äòmeta‚Äô weapons that Activision‚Äôs teams could bring back to Warzone, but I really hope the DMR and Mac-10 combination is kept well away from this iteration of the battle royale game.

It‚Äôs not confirmed, but featuring the weapons front and center in a trailer this close to the launch of season three is pretty telling. If the original timeline were being adhered to, we‚Äôd be just ten days away from the launch of the game‚Äôs third season. Instead, we‚Äôll need to wait until April 3rd.

What weapons do you want to see returning to Warzone this year? Let me know in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Diablo 4 is ‚ÄòToo Easy‚Äô and Blizzard is Preparing to Make it Tougher
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/diablo-4-too-easy-making-tougher/

During a recent campfire stream, Blizzard‚Äôs developers working on Diablo 4 reflected on the most recent season, suggesting that things didn‚Äôt pan out as expected. They confirmed that the game has become far too easy and revealed that players are levelling up in ‚Äòhalf the time‚Äô compared to previous seasons, even on harder difficulty levels.

As someone new to Diablo, I can attest to that. I‚Äôm usually awful at challenging games, but even after cranking it up a few levels, I‚Äôm having no issues whatsoever with Diablo 4.

That‚Äôs set to change, though.

Prepare for Hell

When the next season rolls around in Diablo 4, players will find themselves levelling up slower and facing a tougher grind compared to the current season, which is focused on the Vessel of Hatred expansion.

In the recent campfire stream, Blizzard‚Äôs Colin Finer revealed that players are ‚Äòchewing through some of the content‚Äô much too quickly, hitting level 60 and securing their Paragon classification far too rapidly and with too few struggles.

In season 8, players will find that they‚Äôre levelling slower through the first 25 levels of a new character and that rarer loot ‚Äì such as Legendary items ‚Äì will be much harder to find.

Here‚Äôs the full campfire chat with Blizzard:

(Thanks to Polygon for the spot)

The team revealed that ‚Äòtoo many‚Äô players have found their way into the highest difficulty level of the game in record time, which represents a kind of imbalance in the player base.

Just from a philosophy standpoint, we really want whatever the hardest Torment tier is ‚Äî in this case Torment 4 ‚Äî to be aspirational, and to us that means around 10% (of players).

Presently, around 50% of the players in the Vessel of Hatred season have made it to the highest difficulty level. To battle back against that issue, Blizzard will be adding new, more challenging boss characters in the new season, and existing bosses will have their abilities cranked to the max.

It‚Äôll be a while before all that arrives, though. The next season of Diablo 4 isn‚Äôt expected to drop until April 29.

Do you think Diablo 4 has gotten too easy? Let us know in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: New Last of Us Season 2 Trailer Showcases Expansion of Story
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/last-of-us-season-2-trailer-expansion-of-story/

In the latest trailer for the second season of The Last of Us, we‚Äôre given a brief glimpse at the expansion of the story established in the 2020 game. It has been known for a while that the sheer amount of meat on the bones has given way to the second game having a two-series split in terms of the live-action adaptation, but that hasn‚Äôt stopped the showrunners from creating fresh storylines.

In particular, we‚Äôre given an extended look at the attack on Jackson‚ÄîEllie and Joel‚Äôs home haven in the game‚Äîby vast swathes of infected. This sequence isn‚Äôt replicated in the game, but some of the perspectives are reminiscent of No Return, the additional mode added with the release of The Last of Us Part II Remastered.

Content Galore

The Last of Us Part II has plenty of inspiration to draw from when it comes to creating extra content for the live-action adaptation. In 2023, with the launch of the first season, viewers were treated to an entire episode that explored the backstory of Bill and Frank ‚Äì and that sequence alone won the show an Emmy Award.

In the latest trailer, we get the idea that Craig Mazin, Neil Druckmann, and everyone else involved is following a similar pattern in the second (and assumedly the third) season of the HBO show.

Here‚Äôs the clip:

Once again, the cinematics smack of the most faithful recreation possible, and we can now see that a fair amount of flashback content will be included in season two. For instance, we‚Äôll be heading back to the prequel scenes that see Ellie and Joel explore a museum on Ellie‚Äôs birthday, ultimately discovering a building packed with dinosaurs, spacecraft, and danger.

We also get an extended look at the Seraphites, but it doesn‚Äôt look like Lev and Yara are being revealed just yet. We do see some other sequences that suggest the Seraphites and their background will be explored further in the show, which would help to set up a little more lore for those uninitiated in the story thus far.

The WLF is front and centre, too ‚Äì as is Abby‚Äôs band of antiheroes heading to Jackson for no particular reason whatsoever.

The Last of Us season two drops on April 13 in full ‚Äì are you going to binge watch this one? Let me know in the comments or over on the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: A Microsoft Account is Required to Play Forza Horizon 5 on PlayStation 5
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/forza-horizon-5-ps5-microsoft-account/

A new FAQ from Playground Games has revealed that to play Forza Horizon 5 on the PlayStation 5, players will need a Microsoft account.

The news, which has started to be picked up online (thanks XboxEra), shows in the FAQ that the upcoming port will require a Microsoft account.

It reads, ‚ÄúQ: Do I need a Microsoft account to play Forza Horizon 5 on PlayStation 5?‚Äù

‚ÄúAnswer: A: Yes, in addition to a PSN account you‚Äôll need to link to a Microsoft account in order to play Forza Horizon 5 on PS5. This process begins the first time you start up the game on your console.‚Äù

This isn‚Äôt the first time that an Xbox game coming to the PlayStation 5 has required an account, though, so this isn‚Äôt new. A Microsoft account is needed for the likes of Sea of Thieves and similarly, even for the PlayStation 4 and PlayStation 5 version of Minecraft.

So fear not, this isn‚Äôt a new requirement just for Forza Horizon. However, we have contacted Xbox in the hopes to receive comment to clear the air just in case this was a mistake. Should clarification be given, we‚Äôll update the article.

Forza Horizon 5 is set to release for the PlayStation 5 on April 25, 2025.

item.title: Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Has Turned Hans Capon Into a Superstar Streamer in One Month
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/hans-capon-superstar-streamer-kingdom-come/

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 was released little more than a month ago, storming up the charts and becoming known far and wide as a contender for many Game of the Year awards. It stunned players with its depth, visual splendour, and intense realism, and with a dense roadmap ahead, the game has plenty of life left in its medieval lungs.

Since Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 hit the market, one of the game‚Äôs most prolific actors, Luke ‚ÄòLordHansCapon‚Äô Dale, has positively exploded. He has become a superstar streamer in a matter of weeks, pulling in and retaining an audience and securing solid accolades in no time at all.

Content Fit for a Lord

Luke Dale portrays Hans Capon in the Kingdom Come universe, and he‚Äôs front and centre as the game kicks off, with many of the second title‚Äôs most pivotal moments revolving around his existence. In the first game, which dropped back in 2018, he was someone to be hated, but in KCD2, he‚Äôs a lovable rogue who you‚Äôll go to great lengths to keep safe.

In the days that followed the launch of Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 on February 4, Dale kickstarted a streaming campaign that saw his popularity levels skyrocket across Twitch and YouTube.

In January 2025, the talented actor streamed the first Kingdom Come title in anticipation of the follow-up, netting a peak viewer count of around 350 viewers. Little more than two weeks later, he was picking up peak figures of 20,000 viewers. In one post on social media, Dale revealed he was in the 0.01% of streamers on Twitch by numbers alone.

Dang. I‚Äôm in the top 0.01% of streamers in the world ü´∂ Shall we get to number 1? @KaiCenat I‚Äôm coming for you bro üëä

It didn‚Äôt end there, though.

Luke Dale, who went so far as to get a Kingdom Come tattoo while live, went from 32,000 subscribers on YouTube when the game dropped to 102,000 subscribers at the time of writing. He racked up 15,000 followers on Twitch in around two weeks and managed to secure a Twitch Partner spot after streaming Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 just eight times.

Before 2025, he‚Äôd streamed just three times, according to StreamsCharts. That‚Äôs one hell of a hot streak.

It helps that Dale is genuinely a nice guy with a penchant for performing, and his role as Hans Capon in Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is fantastic and bursting with clippable, quality sequences.

If you want to follow Luke Dale‚Äôs latest streams, you can find him on YouTube or Twitch.
